the disorder is characterized by nīlaṁ ākāśa paśyaṁstamaḥ praviśati [sees the sky as blue and then looses consciousness], kr̥ṣṇaṁ ākāśa paśyaṁstamaḥ praviśati [sees the sky as black and then looses consciousness], aruṇaṁ ākāśa paśyaṁstamaḥ praviśati [sees the sky as red and then looses consciousness], śīghra-pratibudhyatē [regains the consciousness soon], vēpathuḥ [shivering/tremors], aṅgamardaḥ [generalised bodyache], hr̥dayaḥ prapīḍā [pain in the precordium/cardiac region], kārśya [emaciation], śyāva-chāyā [blackish appearance], aruṇa-chāyā [slightly reddish appearance]

the disorder is characterized by rakta paśyaṁstamaḥ viyat praviśati [sees sky as red as he enters into the state of darkness], haritavarṇa paśyaṁstamaḥ viyat praviśati [sees sky as green as he enters into the state of darkness], pīta paśyaṁstamaḥ viyat praviśati [sees sky as yellow as he pass into the state of darkness], sasvēdaḥ prabudhyatē [wakes up with the perspiration], sapipāsā [thirst], sasantāpaḥ [with burning sensation], raktākulēkṣaṇaḥ [reddish disturbed eyes], pītākulēkṣaṇaḥ [yellowish disturbed eyes], jātamātrē patati [as soon as the fit starts he falls down], śīghra-pratibudhyatē [regains conciousness immediately], saṁbhinnavarcāḥ [loose motions], pītābhā [yellowish discolouration], mūrcchā [syncope/attacks of swooning]
